name: Everything Bagel Chaffle with Smoked Salmon Cream Cheese
description: Eating low carb, feeling deprived, and missing your bagel? Here's a quick-and-easy solution to get your bagel fix.
recipeIngredient: 4 tablespoons smoked salmon cream cheese spread (such as Philadelphia®)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a waffle maker according to manufacturer's instructions.
Whisk egg, 2 teaspoons bagel  seasoning, coconut flour, and baking powder together in a small bowl. Stir in mozzarella cheese.

Pour 1/2 of the batter onto the waffle maker and spread it out from the center with a spoon. Close the waffle maker and cook until the chaffle reaches your desired doneness and waffle maker stops steaming, 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove chaffle from waffle maker, place on a rack, and repeat process with remaining batter. Cool for several minutes to let them crisp up.

Spread each chaffle with 1/2 of the salmon cream cheese and garnish with remaining 1 teaspoon bagel seasoning, capers, and red onion. Cut out a circle in the center of the chaffle with a sharp knife or use a 1 1/2-inch round cookie cutter to make the chaffles look more authentic and fun.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Everything Bagel Chaffle with Smoked Salmon Cream Cheese

review.reviewBody: Tasty!  I was somewhat disappointed with the texture, but I think I was just expecting a chewy bagel.  Didn’t have salmon, so I had it with a fried egg.  Will definitely make this again!

Great idea and I had everything on hand.  The chaffle itself was too cheesy for me.  I'll probably use a different recipe with almond flour next time for this application.  Also felt the "Everything Bagel" seasoning overwhelmed the salmon, etc.  Someone gave me a sample and I won't use it again.  BUT thank you for showing me the potential here.  The waffle holes solved the "escaping capers" problem.  From now on they go on as the first layer!  LOL

I bought the dash mini waffle maker just because I had heard of a chaffle and was intrigued since I do keto. This was the first one I made, and glad I did! Satisfied my bagel craving. I only topped with cream cheese and bagel seasoning, but very tasty. Warning though; I did overflow my dash with these so I may have measured heavy on my cheese or it may make slightly large chaffles. Thanks for sharing!
